Technological advancements like blockchain and the internet of things (IoT) can be leveraged to improve supply chain management in Benin's traditional industries in the following ways:

1. Traceability and Transparency: By using blockchain, the supply chain process can be more transparent, and the origin of products can be traced. It can help in identifying the source, transportation, and storage of goods, which will help in building trust among customers.

2. Real-Time Monitoring: The IoT can be used to monitor the delivery of goods in real-time, ensuring their safety, and the condition in which they are delivered. IoT sensors can be used to detect any anomalies, such as temperature or humidity changes, and take corrective measures.

3. Smart Contracts: By implementing smart contracts on blockchain technology, it can help in streamlining the supply chain process, reducing the time and cost involved in managing contracts. It will also transfer funds automatically once the pre-set agreements are met.

4. Payment Solution: Blockchain can make payment processes more seamless and secure. It can eliminate middlemen and speed up the payment process, saving time and money.

5. Quality Control: By monitoring the supply chain using blockchain technology, it can help in detecting counterfeit products or inferior quality products, improving the overall quality of traditional products in Benin.

Overall, Blockchain and IoT technology can help in enhancing the efficiency, transparency, and security of the traditional supply chain industry in Benin, making it more competitive and customer-centric.
